Entries.danceRejection: No, skipper. This body is for fishin', not for dancin'.
Entries.Mon8: I just finished cookin' up yesterday's catch.#$e#Here, have some! Tell me what y'think. [198 209 214 219]
Entries.Mon10: Let's go off on a fishing trip sometime, @.#$e#I'll show you some o' my secrets.$h
Entries.Tue10: My little ol' cottage gets lonely sometimes.#$e#It's nice when you visit, skipper.$4
Entries.Wed8: I heard there's a mutant fish you can catch in the sewers.#$e#Too bad they're all locked up.$h
Entries.Wed10: Even if you hated fishing, I'd still want you as a friend, skipper.$h
Entries.Thu10: I smell a storm brewing...#$e#If you ever get stuck in the rain, you can wait it out in my cottage.$h
Entries.Fri8: Sometimes I stop by the saloon on Friday nights.#$e#I don't drink much, but it gets a little too quiet in the shop during the week.
Entries.Fri10: You look pretty strong... It must be all the farm work.$4#$e#I bet you can cast a fishing line for miles.$4
Entries.Sat10: Do y'think an old sailor like me'll ever find love?$4
Entries.Sun7: Rainy days are best for fishin' trips.#$b#Let's go sometime, eh, skipper?$h

Entries.give_flowersA: Oh, my...$h#$b#These are for me then, skipper?$4#$b#I suppose a little love won't be so bad.
Entries.give_flowersB: Why, skipper...$h#$b#I had no idea! Yes! Of course!$4#$b#The sea will just have to get used to sharing.$h
Entries.give_pendant: Hmm... if it's you, skipper, then...$h#$b#Yes. I'll marry you.$4#$b#I'll go talk to ol' Lewis and say my goodbyes to my boat.$h
Entries.stardrop_gift: Skipper, got something to say.$4#$b#I wanted to give you this stardrop to show my love.$h#$b#Thank you. For everything.$h
Entries.rejectNPCA: I took my rod out of that pond ages ago... The sea is my lover.$h
Entries.rejectNPCB: Nothing can take my heart from the sea.#$b#I am hers forever.$h
Entries.reject_two_heartA: Ah, laddie. There are plenty of other fish in the sea ^Ah lassie. There are plenty of other fish in the sea.
Entries.reject_two_heartB: Why don't you ask that nice Elliot fella over in the cabin yonder, skipper?$h
Entries.reject_four_heartA: A nice thought. But I'd never be home. The sea is a cruel mistress like that.$h
Entries.reject_four_heartB: I'm sure you have better options than some sea-dog.
Entries.engageA: I don't feel comfortable with you doing this.$2
Entries.engageB: You're going to break someone's heart like that.$2
Entries.marriedA: Aren't you being a little greedy?$2
Entries.refusal_knownA: Managed to track down that old mariner, did you? Or is that just a ghost tale?$h
Entries.refusal_knownB: I think I saw a mermaid once. They do exist, you know?
Entries.refusal_botherA: I don't know what game you're playing skipper, but this needs to stop.$5
Entries.refusal_botherB: I don't want to be land-locked away from my truest love.$5
Entries.refusal_no_heartsA: That's a valuable item.  Don't sell it.
Entries.refusal_no_heartsB: Ahhh a Mermaid's Pendant.  Hold on to that for someone you truly love.$h

Entries.give_flowersA: Now skipper, these aren't going to do well in the sea salt at work.$4
Entries.give_flowersB: Yes, they're lovely. But not as much as you, skipper.$h
Entries.give_pendant: Haha, skipper. Didn't you already ask?$h#$b#Yes again, in case it was a dream.$4
Entries.engageA: It's very unusal to have multiple. Does the mariner think you have more lovers?$h
Entries.engageB: Mermaids... it's strange that they just let us have these to declare eternal love, don't you think?
Entries.marriedA: These are supposed to be rare. Where do you keep getting them?
Entries.marriedB: How many did that mariner give you?

Entries.Rainy_Day_Willy: There’s a storm brewing out there. Don’t blow away!
Entries.Rainy_Night_Willy: May be rotten weather for farming, but it's perfect weather to cuddle up with my little angelfish.$h#$e#Let's go to bed.$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_Willy: Hurry back tonight, skipper!#$e#I’m cooking up the fish I caught the other day for dinner.$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_Willy: Come 'ere and try this fish I made, skipper. [198 214 242 728 202 225 212]#$e#Like it?$h
Entries.Outdoor_Willy: It’s a good day for fishing.$h#$e#I might be late tonight, so don’t you worry, my little angelfish.
Entries.summer_Willy: I gotta gut these fish I caught the other day after work...#$e#Don't worry, skipper. I'll take 'em out back. %pet can eat the guts.$h
Entries.fall_Willy: Sure cooled off quick, eh, skipper?
Entries.winter_Willy: Snow on the ground? This early?
Entries.Rainy_Day_0: There’s a storm brewing out there. Don’t blow away!
Entries.Rainy_Day_1: It’s pouring out there!#$e#Try to keep warm, my little angelfish.$h
Entries.Rainy_Day_2: There's nothin' better than rain.#$e#I bet the fish are really biting today.$h
Entries.Rainy_Day_3: Do you really have to go out in that rain, my little angelfish?$s
Entries.Rainy_Night_0: Hearing the rain reminds me of lonely nights on the sea.#$e#I’m so happy to have my skipper now.$4
Entries.Rainy_Night_1: You look like a drowned cat!$s#$e#Come here and get warm. I made you dinner. [727 728 457]$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_2: It sure is nasty out there.#$e#I'm glad I’m here with you instead of out sailin' the seas.$h
Entries.Rainy_Night_3: May be rotten weather for farming, but it's perfect weather to cuddle up with my little angelfish.$h#$e#Let's go to bed.$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_0: Good morning, my little angelfish.$h#$e#I made breakfast. [194 195 210 211 216]
Entries.Indoor_Day_1: Hurry back tonight, skipper!#$e#I’m cooking up the fish I caught the other day for dinner.$h
Entries.Indoor_Day_2: Off to take care o' the farm?$h#$e#Keep yourself hydrated, skipper. [184]
Entries.Indoor_Day_3: Good day for a picnic down by the beach, eh, skipper?$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_0: Hey, my little angelfish. Did you have a good day?$h#$e#Tell me about it.$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_1: Look at the size of that moon.
Entries.Indoor_Night_2: Come 'ere and try this fish I made, skipper. [198 214 242 728 202 225 212]#$e#Like it?$h
Entries.Indoor_Night_3: 'Bout time for bed, ain't it?$h#$e#Coming, my little angelfish?$4
Entries.Outdoor_0: The farm is looking beautiful.#$e#I sure am proud of you.$h
Entries.Outdoor_1: Beautiful day today.#$e#We should take a walk together when yer work is done.$h
Entries.Outdoor_2: It’s such a nice day... I hope that’s not a rain cloud I see.
Entries.Outdoor_3: It’s a good day for fishing.$h#$e#I might be late tonight, so don’t you worry, my little angelfish.
Entries.OneKid_0: Never thought I’d have kids o' my own. I’m the happiest sailor in the world.$h
Entries.OneKid_1: I can’t wait 'til %kid1 is old enough to go fishin' with me.#$e#Just imagine a little family fishin' trip.$h
Entries.OneKid_2: Do you think the kiddo looks anything like me?#$e#Must've gotten all them good looks from you.$h
Entries.OneKid_3: I still can’t believe we made such a beautiful little thing.$h
Entries.TwoKids_0: After livin' alone for so long, it’s such a blessing to have two little kiddos runnin' around.$h
Entries.TwoKids_1: Do I tell you how much I love our little family often enough?$h
Entries.TwoKids_2: The kiddos and I are gonna practice casting the line in the back yard.$h#$e#What? They're big enough...$s
Entries.TwoKids_3: %kid1 is already just like you.$h#$e#%kid2? Just like me!$h
Entries.Good_0: You sure are handsome. If I didn’t know any better I’d say you were a siren of the sea.$4^You sure are beautiful. If I didn't know any better I'd say you were a siren of the sea.$4
Entries.Good_1: I may not have much, but I’d willingly give you all I got if it meant a lifetime o' happiness for my angelfish.$h
Entries.Good_2: Your smile is the lighthouse that guides me home from the sea, my lovely angelfish.$4
Entries.Good_3: The only thing I want is to grow old with my skipper.$h
Entries.Good_4: I’d give up my best fishin' rod if it was for you, skipper.$h
Entries.Good_5: Every sailor dreams of findin' treasure at sea.#$e#Lucky for this ol' sailor, mine was waiting for me here on land.$4
Entries.Good_6: I think it'd be okay if the sea dried up, 'cause I’d still have you, angelfish.$h
Entries.Good_7: You’ve made me the happiest sailor alive.$4$e#Not even catchin' the legendary fish could make me happier.$h
Entries.Neutral_0: I’m so hungry I could eat a whale.
Entries.Neutral_1: I dropped my tackle box on my toe... it hurt worse than that time I got bit by a snapping turtle.$s
Entries.Neutral_2: I almost caught the biggest tuna yesterday, but the darn thing broke my line.$5
Entries.Neutral_3: What are your plans for today? I might head off to fish for a bit.
Entries.Bad_0: I don’t feel like talkin' right now.$s
Entries.Bad_1: You’re a heartless scallywag. Leave me alone.$5
Entries.Bad_2: I miss bein' on my boat. Didn’t have to put up with no one.$5
Entries.funLeave_Willy: I gotta go run the ol' bait shop today, skipper.#$e#Stop by if you feel like sayin' hello. It gets a little lonely out there.$h
Entries.funReturn_Willy: What'd ya do today, skipper?#$e#The ol' shop is as quiet as ever. I did stop to do some fishin' on the way back, though.#$e#They were really bitin'. Here, skipper. [147 149 146 139]#$e#Maybe you can cook us up some dinner with it.$h
Entries.spring_1: It’s a new year already, eh?#$e#I wonder if the anchovies are biting yet...
Entries.spring_12: You’re pretty good at finding eggs, eh?#$e#I’ll just stick to fish hunting...
Entries.spring_23: Would you like to dance with me tomorrow, my little angelfish?$h
Entries.summer_1: Whew! It sure is hot out there.#$e#We’ll probably see lots o' rainbow trout.$h
Entries.summer_10: What're you gonna add to the soup tomorrow, skipper?#$e#Me? I usually add catfish.$h
Entries.summer_27: I used to watch the moon jellies out on my boat alone, but now that I have you they’re gonna be ten times more beautiful.$h
Entries.fall_1: It’s getting cooler out... Hope we see some salmon soon!
Entries.fall_15: Let's try the fishin' game tomorrow, skipper. I’ll win you a prize.$h
Entries.fall_26: I don't much care for that haunted maze.#$e#I'll lead the way if yer scared, though, my little angelfish.$h
Entries.winter_1: Brr... sure is cold out there.#$e#Time to break out my ice fishing gear!$h
Entries.winter_7: Now this is my kind of festival! I’m gonna win this year.#$e#I wish they had more fishing contests.$h
Entries.winter_24: All I want for tomorrow's festival is you, skipper... and a new tackle box.$h
Entries.winter_28: It’s been a good year for fishin', but it’s been an even better year 'cause o' you, my little angelfish.$4#$e#Let's drink. [346]
Entries.spouseRoom_Willy: #$c .5#This tank'll be perfect when it's all set up.#$e#What kind of fish...? Whatever kind I catch!$h#$e#Now, where did I put that filter the other day...
Entries.patio_Willy: Shoot... this line's all tangled up...

Entries.marriage_Tue.000: Ahoy, my little angelfish. Whaddaya need?$h
Entries.marriage_Thu.000: I'll be home early today, angelfish. Don't miss me too much.
Entries.marriage_Fri.000: I'll be headin' to the saloon when I'm done here, skipper. You should come along.
Entries.marriage_Fri.001: Ah, what a great way to relax. I'm glad you're here, skipper.$h

Entries.Willy0: You wanna marry this ol' fisherman?#$e#Good! He wants to marry you, too.$h
Entries.Willy1: There are a lot of fish in the sea...#$e#I'm glad we found each other, skipper.$h

Entries.fishingInvite: @,^It's a perfect day for a fishing trip!^Pack up your rain gear and meet me at my shack when yer' ready to go! I'll be waitin'!^^-Willy
Entries.fishingTrip: @,^Let's go on a fishing trip... I promise I won't be sick this time!^Swing by my shop any time yer' ready.^^-Willy

Entries.CF_Fish: Dear @, my beloved skipper, ^ Your angling skills surpass even my ol' Pappy's... I'm impressed. ^ This stardrop's been passed down from Willy Sr. to Willy Jr. for... oh, heck. Prob'ly a thousand years.^Seein' as how we're married and all... I want you to have it.^^ -Willy   ^  %item object 434 1 %%
